intro: Pedicularis cristata, commonly known as the crown vetch, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of pink or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a slightly hairy surface. Pedicularis cristata is often found in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun.
